text: Virat Binod Singh (born 8 December 1997), is an Indian cricketer. Training under his childhood coach/mentor Venkatram, Virat made his senior debut for Jharkhand during the 2013–14 season, aged 16. A left-handed batsman who customarily comes in third in the batting order, he has also played interzonal matches, making his debut for East Zone in December 2014, in the Deodhar Trophy. In IPL 2020, he was bought by the Sunrisers Hyderabad for 1.9 crores. ==Career== From Jamshedpur, which was part of Jharkhand at the time of his birth, Virat made his debut for the Jharkhand under-19s at the age of 14, in the 2012–13 edition of the Vinoo Mankad Trophy.Miscellaneous matches played by Virat Singh (48) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. He scored 152 runs from five innings in the tournament, behind only his older brother, Vishal Singh (179), and Shasheem Rathour (280).Batting and fielding for Jharkhand Under-19s, Vinoo Mankad Trophy 2012/13 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. He scored a half-century, 73 runs from 98 balls, against Assam,Assam Under-19s v Jharkhand Under-19s, Vinoo Mankad Trophy 2012/13 (East Zone) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. and also topscored in Jharkhand's quarter-final loss to Maharashtra.Jharkhand Under-19s v Maharashtra Under-19s, Vinoo Mankad Trophy 2012/13 (Quarter-Final) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Following his good form for his state, Virat was selected to play in the 2012–13 BCCI interzonal competition, alongside his brother Vishal. His best performance was an innings of 78 against Central Zone, which was the highest score by an East Zone player at the tournament.Central Zone Under-19s v East Zone Under-19s, BCCI Under-19s Inter Zonal Tournament 2012/13 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015.Batting and fielding for East Zone Under-19s, BCCI Under-19s Inter-Zonal Tournament 2012/13 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Virat again played under-19 matches for Jharkhand and East Zone during the 2013–14 season, and captained Jharkhand in that season's Cooch Behar Trophy, despite being only 15 at the start of the tournament. He led East Zone in runs in the interzonal one-day tournament,Batting and fielding for East Zone Under-19s, BCCI Under-19 Inter-Zonal Tournament 2013/14 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. with a best of 146 not out against West Zone,East Zone Under-19s v West Zone Under-19s, BCCI Under-19s Inter Zonal Tournament 2013/14 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. and did the same for Jharkhand in the four-day Cooch Behar Trophy, finishing with 508 runs from five matches.Batting and fielding for Jharkhand Under-19s, Cooch Behar Trophy 2013/14 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. This included two centuries – 120* against Assam, and 190 against Andhra.Jharkhand Under-19s v Assam Under-19s, Cooch Behar Trophy 2013/14 (Plate Group B) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015.Jharkhand Under-19s v Andhra Under-19s, Cooch Behar Trophy 2013/14 (Plate Group B) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Later in the 2013–14 season, in March 2014, Virat was selected to make his senior debut for Jharkhand, playing in the limited-overs Vijay Hazare Trophy.List A matches played by Virat Singh – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. He played all five of Jharkhand's matches in the tournament as the team progressed to the semifinals,Batting and fielding for Jharkhand, Vijay Hazare Trophy 2013/14 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. and scored two half-centuries – 76 against Bengal and 53 against Assam.Bengal v Jharkhand, Vijay Hazare Trophy 2013/14 (East Zone) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015.Jharkhand v Assam, Vijay Hazare Trophy 2013/14 (East Zone) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Virat's one-day form gained him a place in Jharkhand's team at the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy the following month, India's interstate twenty20 competition.Twenty20 matches played by Virat Singh – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. There, he was less successful, with only 90 runs from seven innings and a strike rate of 84.90.Batting and fielding for Jharkhand, Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2013/14 – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. He did topscore against Orissa, making 40 runs from 45 balls as Jharkhand lost by four runs.Jharkhand v Orissa, Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2013/14 (East Zone) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Virat retained in spot in Jharkhand's senior side for the 2014–15 season, while still playing at domestic under-19 level with the aim of qualifying for the Indian national under-19 team.Sandipan Banerjee (15 January 2015). "Virat Singh: Representing India in ICC Under-19 world Cup 2016 is my immediate goal" – Cricket Country. Retrieved 16 March 2015. He made his Ranji Trophy debut in December 2014, against Assam, and scored a maiden first- class century in his second match, an even 100 against Kerala.Jharkhand v Kerala, Ranji Trophy 2014/15 (Group C) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. While he was on 99, there was a stumping appeal, which the third umpire took several minutes to adjudicate as not out.Pratik Bandyopadhyay (29 December 2014). "Finally, a Virat sparkle for Jharkhand" – Times of India. Retrieved 16 March 2015. Virat also made his senior debut for East Zone later in the season, and scored 54 runs in the final of the limited-overs Deodhar Trophy. This included a 135-run third-wicket partnership with Manoj Tiwary, with East Zone going on to win the final by 24 runs, its first Deodhar Trophy since the 2003–04 season.West Zone v East Zone, Deodhar Trophy 2014/15 (Final) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 16 March 2015. In October 2019, he was named in India C's squad for the 2019–20 Deodhar Trophy. ===IPL career=== He was bought by Sunrisers Hyderabad for a price of 1.90 crore for the 2020 Indian Premier League. ==References== ==External links== *Player profile and statistics at CricketArchive *Player profile and statistics at ESPNcricinfo Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:East Zone cricketers Category:Indian cricketers Category:Jharkhand cricketers Category:People from Jamshedpur Category:Cricketers from Jharkhand
